column10: HDMI carries video and audio signals between devices.
RSVP is French for "please respond" used on invitations.
NYSE is the world's largest stock exchange by market cap.
HDTV provides higher resolution than standard television.

column10: explanation
The CPU executes instructions and is the brain of the computer.
RAM is volatile memory used for temporary data storage while programs run.
APIs let different software systems communicate with each other.
HTML is the standard markup language for creating web pages.
CSS describes how HTML elements should be displayed.
GPS uses satellites to determine location anywhere on Earth.
NASA is the US federal agency responsible for space programs.
The FBI is the domestic intelligence and security service of the United States.
The CEO is the highest-ranking person in a company.
GDP measures the total value of goods and services produced by a country.
USB is an industry standard for cables and connectors.
WiFi is a wireless networking technology using radio waves.
PDF is a file format developed by Adobe for document sharing.
ATMs allow customers to perform banking transactions without a human teller.
DNA carries genetic instructions for all known living organisms.
LEDs are semiconductor devices that emit light when current flows through them.
FAQs are lists of common questions and answers about a topic.
VIP refers to someone accorded special privileges due to their status.
DIY refers to building or repairing something without professional help.
ASAP is used to indicate something needs urgent attention.
HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web.
JSON is a lightweight data interchange format that's easy for humans to read.
SQL is used to communicate with and manipulate databases.
URL is the address of a resource on the Internet.
WWW is the system of interlinked hypertext documents accessed via the Internet.
PhD is the highest academic degree awarded by universities.
MBA is a graduate degree focused on business administration and management.
IQ is a score derived from standardized tests to assess human intelligence.
ETA indicates when something or someone is expected to arrive.
FYI is used to draw attention to information someone should know.
LOL is used in digital communication to indicate something is funny.
BRB indicates someone will return shortly in online conversations.
JPEG is a commonly used method of lossy compression for digital images.
GIF is a bitmap image format that supports animation.
DVD is an optical disc storage format invented in 1995.
AI refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines.
VR is a simulated experience that can be similar to or different from the real world.
AR is an interactive experience where digital elements are added to the real world.
IoT refers to physical devices connected to the internet and each other.
